title: Beetroot chocolate cake
directions: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Grease a 20cm/8in cake tin with a little butter and line the bottom of the tin with a disc of baking parchment.
Blend the beetroot in a food processor to a rough purée.

Melt the chocolate in a bowl suspended over a pan of hot water (do not allow the bottom of the bowl to touch the water), then pour in the hot coffee. Technique: Melting chocolate Watch technique 1:06 mins
Stir in the butter in small pieces and leave to soften. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, sift the flour, baking powder and cocoa together in a bowl and set aside.
Separate the eggs. Whisk the yolks in a bowl until frothy. Stir the eggs into the chocolate and butter mixture, then fold in the beetroot. Technique: How to separate eggs Watch technique 0:58 mins
Whisk the egg whites until still peaks form when the whisk is removed. Fold in the sugar. Technique: Whisking egg whites Watch technique 0:59 mins
Fold the sugar and egg whites into the chocolate mixture, then fold in the flour and cocoa mixture. Technique: Folding Watch technique 0:35 mins
Pour the batter into the prepared tin and bake for 40 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. Technique: Testing to see if a cake is cooked Watch technique 0:29 mins
Allow to cool in the tin, then serve with crème fraîche or double cream.
ingredients: crème fraîche or double cream, to serve
